fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • The blood of horseshoe crabs does not contain limulus amoebocyte lysate (LAL), as an article said. The arthropods’ blood is used to make LAL, which is used in medical situations to test for the presence of bacteria (The hero crab, 3 November, page 15). • Other recently corrected articles include: White House defends doctored Trump-Acosta clip used to justify reporter’s ban Babies born to older fathers ‘tend to have more medical issues’ Keys to prosperity in the north’s great cities
